trans-unit.source: Repairing an Export Job
trans-unit.target: Repairing an Export Job

trans-unit.source: After an export job has completed, you can run the Microsoft Azure Import/Export tool on premise to:
trans-unit.target: After an export job has completed, you can run the Microsoft Azure Import/Export tool on premise to:

trans-unit.source: Download any files that the Azure Import/Export service was unable to export.
trans-unit.target: Download any files that the Azure Import/Export service was unable to export.

trans-unit.source: Validate that the files on the drive were correctly exported.
trans-unit.target: Validate that the files on the drive were correctly exported.

trans-unit.source: You must have connectivity to Azure Storage to use this functionality.
trans-unit.target: You must have connectivity to Azure Storage to use this functionality.

trans-unit.source: The command for repairing an import job is <legacyBold>RepairExport</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: The command for repairing an import job is <legacyBold>RepairExport</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: The following parameters can be specified:
trans-unit.target: The following parameters can be specified:

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Path to the repair file, which tracks the progress of the repair, and allows you to resume an interrupted repair.
trans-unit.target: Path to the repair file, which tracks the progress of the repair, and allows you to resume an interrupted repair.

trans-unit.source: Each drive must have one and only one repair file.
trans-unit.target: Each drive must have one and only one repair file.

trans-unit.source: When you start a repair for a given drive, you will pass in the path to a repair file which does not yet exist.
trans-unit.target: When you start a repair for a given drive, you will pass in the path to a repair file which does not yet exist.

trans-unit.source: To resume an interrupted repair, you should pass in the name of an existing repair file.
trans-unit.target: To resume an interrupted repair, you should pass in the name of an existing repair file.

trans-unit.source: The repair file corresponding to the target drive must always be specified.
trans-unit.target: The repair file corresponding to the target drive must always be specified.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The log directory.
trans-unit.target: The log directory.

trans-unit.source: Verbose log files will be written to this directory.
trans-unit.target: Verbose log files will be written to this directory.

trans-unit.source: If no log directory is specified, the current directory will be used as the log directory.
trans-unit.target: If no log directory is specified, the current directory will be used as the log directory.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The directory to validate and repair.
trans-unit.target: The directory to validate and repair.

trans-unit.source: This is usually the root directory of the export drive, but could also be a network file share containing a copy of the exported files.
trans-unit.target: This is usually the root directory of the export drive, but could also be a network file share containing a copy of the exported files.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: You should specify the BitLocker key if you want the tool to unlock an encrypted where the exported files are stored.
trans-unit.target: You should specify the BitLocker key if you want the tool to unlock an encrypted where the exported files are stored.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The name of the storage account for the export job.
trans-unit.target: The name of the storage account for the export job.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel> if and only if a container SAS is not specified.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel> if and only if a container SAS is not specified.

trans-unit.source: The account key for the storage account for the export job.
trans-unit.target: The account key for the storage account for the export job.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel> if and only if the storage account key is not specified.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel> if and only if the storage account key is not specified.

trans-unit.source: The container SAS for accessing the blobs associated with the export job.
trans-unit.target: The container SAS for accessing the blobs associated with the export job.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: The path to the drive copy log file.
trans-unit.target: The path to the drive copy log file.

trans-unit.source: The file is generated by the Windows Azure Import/Export service and can be downloaded from the blob storage associated with the job.
trans-unit.target: The file is generated by the Windows Azure Import/Export service and can be downloaded from the blob storage associated with the job.

trans-unit.source: The copy log file contains information about failed blobs or files which are to be repaired.
trans-unit.target: The copy log file contains information about failed blobs or files which are to be repaired.

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: The path to the export drive's manifest file.
trans-unit.target: The path to the export drive's manifest file.

trans-unit.source: This file is generated by the Windows Azure Import/Export service and stored on the export drive, and optionally in a blob in the storage account associated with the job.
trans-unit.target: This file is generated by the Windows Azure Import/Export service and stored on the export drive, and optionally in a blob in the storage account associated with the job.

trans-unit.source: The content of the files on the export drive will be verified with the MD5 hashes contained in this file.
trans-unit.target: The content of the files on the export drive will be verified with the MD5 hashes contained in this file.

trans-unit.source: Any files that are determined to be corrupted will be downloaded and rewritten to the target directories.
trans-unit.target: Any files that are determined to be corrupted will be downloaded and rewritten to the target directories.

trans-unit.source: Using RepairExport Mode to Correct Failed Exports
trans-unit.target: Using RepairExport Mode to Correct Failed Exports

trans-unit.source: You can use the Azure Import/Export tool to download files that failed to export.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Azure Import/Export tool to download files that failed to export.

trans-unit.source: The copy log file will contain a list of files that failed to export.
trans-unit.target: The copy log file will contain a list of files that failed to export.

trans-unit.source: The causes of export failures include the following possibilities:
trans-unit.target: The causes of export failures include the following possibilities:

trans-unit.source: Damaged drives
trans-unit.target: Damaged drives

trans-unit.source: The storage account key changed during the transfer process
trans-unit.target: The storage account key changed during the transfer process

trans-unit.source: To run the tool in <legacyBold>RepairExport</legacyBold> mode, you first need to connect the drive containing the exported files to your computer.
trans-unit.target: To run the tool in <legacyBold>RepairExport</legacyBold> mode, you first need to connect the drive containing the exported files to your computer.

trans-unit.source: Next, run the Azure Import/Export tool, specifying the path to that drive with the <codeInline>/d</codeInline> parameter.
trans-unit.target: Next, run the Azure Import/Export tool, specifying the path to that drive with the <codeInline>/d</codeInline> parameter.

trans-unit.source: You also need to specify the path to the drive's copy log file that you downloaded.
trans-unit.target: You also need to specify the path to the drive's copy log file that you downloaded.

trans-unit.source: The following command line example below runs the tool to repair any files that failed to export:
trans-unit.target: The following command line example below runs the tool to repair any files that failed to export:

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of a copy log file that shows that one block in the blob failed to export:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of a copy log file that shows that one block in the blob failed to export:

trans-unit.source: The copy log file indicates that a failure occurred while the Windows Azure Import/Export service was downloading one of the blob's blocks to the file on the export drive.
trans-unit.target: The copy log file indicates that a failure occurred while the Windows Azure Import/Export service was downloading one of the blob's blocks to the file on the export drive.

trans-unit.source: The other components of the file downloaded successfully, and the file length was correctly set.
trans-unit.target: The other components of the file downloaded successfully, and the file length was correctly set.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the tool will open the file on the drive, download the block from the storage account, and write it to the file range starting from offset 65536 with length 65536.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the tool will open the file on the drive, download the block from the storage account, and write it to the file range starting from offset 65536 with length 65536.

trans-unit.source: Using RepairExport to Validate Drive Contents
trans-unit.target: Using RepairExport to Validate Drive Contents

trans-unit.source: You can also use Azure Import/Export with the <legacyBold>RepairExport</legacyBold> option to validate the contents on the drive are correct.
trans-unit.target: You can also use Azure Import/Export with the <legacyBold>RepairExport</legacyBold> option to validate the contents on the drive are correct.

trans-unit.source: The manifest file on each export drive contains MD5s for the contents of the drive.
trans-unit.target: The manifest file on each export drive contains MD5s for the contents of the drive.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Import/Export service can also save the manifest files to a storage account during the export process.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Import/Export service can also save the manifest files to a storage account during the export process.

trans-unit.source: The location of the manifest files is available via the <link xlink:href="1d416186-c5a7-423c-9a24-bad4f7b89828" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Job</link> operation when the job has completed.
trans-unit.target: The location of the manifest files is available via the <link xlink:href="1d416186-c5a7-423c-9a24-bad4f7b89828" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Job</link> operation when the job has completed.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="f3119e1c-2c25-48ad-8752-a6ed4adadbb0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Manifest File Format</link> for more information about the format of a drive manifest file.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="f3119e1c-2c25-48ad-8752-a6ed4adadbb0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Import/Export Service Manifest File Format</link> for more information about the format of a drive manifest file.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to run the Azure Import/Export tool with the <system>/ManifestFile</system> and <system>/CopyLogFile</system> parameters:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to run the Azure Import/Export tool with the <system>/ManifestFile</system> and <system>/CopyLogFile</system> parameters:

trans-unit.source: The following is an example of a manifest file:
trans-unit.target: The following is an example of a manifest file:

trans-unit.source: After finishing the repair process, the tool will read through each file referenced in the manifest file and verify the file's integrity with the MD5 hashes.
trans-unit.target: After finishing the repair process, the tool will read through each file referenced in the manifest file and verify the file's integrity with the MD5 hashes.

trans-unit.source: For the manifest above, it will go through the following components.
trans-unit.target: For the manifest above, it will go through the following components.

trans-unit.source: G:\pictures\city\redmond.jpg, offset 0, length 3584
trans-unit.target: G:\pictures\city\redmond.jpg, offset 0, length 3584

trans-unit.source: G:\pictures\city\redmond.jpg, offset 3584, length 3584
trans-unit.target: G:\pictures\city\redmond.jpg, offset 3584, length 3584

trans-unit.source: G:\pictures\city\redmond.jpg, offset 7168, length 3584
trans-unit.target: G:\pictures\city\redmond.jpg, offset 7168, length 3584

trans-unit.source: G:\pictures\city\redmond.jpg.properties
trans-unit.target: G:\pictures\city\redmond.jpg.properties

trans-unit.source: G:\pictures\wild\canyon.jpg, offset 0, length 2721
trans-unit.target: G:\pictures\wild\canyon.jpg, offset 0, length 2721

trans-unit.source: G:\pictures\wild\canyon.jpg, offset 2721, length 2721
trans-unit.target: G:\pictures\wild\canyon.jpg, offset 2721, length 2721

trans-unit.source: G:\pictures\wild\canyon.jpg, offset 5442, length 2721
trans-unit.target: G:\pictures\wild\canyon.jpg, offset 5442, length 2721

trans-unit.source: G:\pictures\wild\canyon.jpg, offset 8163, length 2721
trans-unit.target: G:\pictures\wild\canyon.jpg, offset 8163, length 2721

trans-unit.source: G:\pictures\wild\canyon.jpg.properties
trans-unit.target: G:\pictures\wild\canyon.jpg.properties

trans-unit.source: Any component failing the verification will be downloaded by the tool and rewritten to the same file on the drive.
trans-unit.target: Any component failing the verification will be downloaded by the tool and rewritten to the same file on the drive.
